page.title: 02 A TYPICAL FARMER
page.content: {Mr Clark lives and farms at Lowlands {Farm which lies off a lane leading {from the Helperby to Tollerton {road.It is a tenant farm and Mr Clark {has occupied it since 1972. It is run {as a family business and in {conjunction with his brother's farm {at Shipton by Beningbrough. { The majority of his acreage is given {over to corn although he also has 45 {acres of sugar beet and 5 acres of {potatoes. Apart from 2.5 acres of poor {land Mr Clark's land is excellent. {Apart from arable land Mr Clark {presently owns 22 sheep although {normally he has a herd of 100. { Lowlands Farm lies at the end of a {mile long drive and is not easy to {find. He is still waiting for a man {from the Ministry of Agriculture to {come and look over his equipment - and {that was two whole years ago!
